content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure, here's an example of how you might write such a function:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Find all code blocks in the markdown document
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```(.*?)```", md))
    
    if isempty(blocks)  # If no code block exists, return an empty string.
        return ""
    end

    # Concatenate all found code blocks into one string and remove new line characters
    result = join([replace(block[1], "\n", "") for block in blocks]; "\n")

    return result
end
```

This function works by using a regular expression to find all code blocks within the markdown document. It then concatenates these code blocks together into one string and removes any newline characters (\n) present in the code blocks.

You can call this function on your markdown with: `extract_julia_code(your_markdown)`
